definition: to gradually stop feeding a baby or young animal with its mother’s milk and start feeding it with solid food
a solid shape with many flat sides, usually more than six
having many flat sides, usually more than six
a deep hole made in the ground, especially to find water or oil
a substance that is used in making some perfumes. It is produced naturally by a type of whale.
a low wall built at the side of a river to prevent it from flooding
a place on a river where boats can let passengers on or off
a state of extreme excitement, fear or anger in which a person, or a group of people, loses control of their emotions and starts to cry, laugh, etc.
an extremely excited and exaggerated way of behaving or reacting to an event
a condition in which somebody experiences violent or extreme emotions that they cannot control, especially as a result of shock
a form of government in which the leaders use their power to steal money and resources from the country that they rule
a society that is ruled by a kleptocracy
a person who has a strong desire, which they cannot control, to steal things
